position.marginalia_text: Nulla dies sine apophthegmate: Epigrammate: et dicterio è visceribus Facetiarium.

book.title: Facetie, mottie et burle di diversi signori et persone private

marginalia.translation: Not one day without aphorisms, epigrams, and a joke taken from the heart of the Facetie.

position.marginalia_text: Quicquid est in deo, est deus. quicquid in uiro, vir.

marginalia.translation: Whatever is in God, is God; whatever is in man, is man.

position.marginalia_text: Tranquillitas, et Constantia: Lipsius, tria, Tranq[uillitas], Const[antia], et Pietas.

marginalia.translation: Tranquillity and Constancy. Lipsius, in three words: Tranquillity, Constancy, and Piety.

position.marginalia_text: Plenior vitalium, animaliumq[ue] spirituum Eutrapelus, quàm ullus adhuc alius.

marginalia.translation: Eutrapelus is more full of vital energies and animal spirits, more than anyone else up till now.

position.marginalia_text: Dict[um], et ictum: imò, ictum, et dictum: Entelechissimi apophthegma, ex arcanis.

marginalia.translation: The saying and the blow, or rather, the blow and the saying: the aphorism of a most practical man from hidden things.

position.marginalia_text: Occulta philosophia adamantini ingenij, et fatalis spiculi.

marginalia.translation: The occult philosophy of an adamantine character and of a fatal sting. The riddle.

position.marginalia_text: Ludus, iocusq[ue], ipse Ca[e]sar Borgia: pra[e] huius rabie.

marginalia.translation: A game and a joke, Caesar Borgia himself, before his madness.
